key_points: Dwayne Johnson announced his production company, Seven Bucks Productions, will not use real guns but rubber guns in future projects.
The decision was a response to the tragic shooting on the Rust movie set, which resulted in the death of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins.
Johnson vowed to implement the 'no real guns' rule in any project his company is involved in, regardless of the cost.
Cinematographer Halyna Hutchins died after being shot by a prop gun discharged by actor Alec Baldwin, who was told it was safe.
Director Joel Souza was injured in the same incident but survived.
The shooting is still under investigation.
Alec Baldwin referred to Hutchins' death as a 'tragic accident' and expressed being heartbroken over the incident.
Johnson expressed his heartbreak over the incident and his sympathy for Hutchins' family and the Rust set members.
Johnson's remarks were made ahead of the release of his new Netflix action film, Red Notice.
Eric Kripke, showrunner of Amazon's The Boys, also committed to not using real guns and encouraged others to do the same.
